enWisdom: Wealth is the leader of the wicked

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ يَطْلُبُ الْكَمَالَ الْجَاهِلُ يَطْلُبُ الْمَالَ
enWisdom: The intelligent one seeks perfection, the ignorant one seeks wealth
Wealth does not benefit you until it parts from you

Wisdom: الْمَالُ يُكْرِمُ صَاحِبَهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَيُهِينُهُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: Wealth honours its possessor in this world and abases him in front of Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: الْمَالُ يَرْفَعُ صَاحِبَهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَيَضَعُهُ فِي الْآخِرَةِ
enWisdom: Wealth elevates its possessor in this world but lowers him in the Hereafter

Wisdom: الْمَالُ وَبَالٌ عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ إِلَّا مَا قَدَّمَ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Wealth is a burden for its possessor except that which he sends ahead from it [for the Hereafter]

Wisdom: الْمَالُ تَنْقُصُهُ النَّفَقَةُ وَالْعِلْمُ يَزْكُو عَلَى الْإِنْفَاقِ
enWisdom: Wealth is reduced by spending [it] whereas knowledge grows when it is given away [and shared with others]

Wisdom: النَّاسُ مِنْ خَوْفِ الذُّلِّ مُتَعَجِّلُوا الذُّلِّ
enWisdom: Out of fear of humiliation, people are hastening [towards] humiliation

Wisdom: أَمْسِكْ مِنَ الْمَالِ بِقَدْرِ ضَرُورَتِكَ وَقَدِّمِ الْفَضْلَ لِيَوْمِ فَاقَتِكَ
enWisdom: Hold on to wealth according to the extent of your need, and forward the rest for the day of your indigence

Wisdom: إِذَا أَحَبَّ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَبْداً بَغَّضَ إِلَيْهِ الْمَالَ وَقَصَّرَ مِنْهُ الْآمَالَ
enWisdom: When Allah loves a servant, He makes him hate wealth and shortens his hopes

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَادَ بِعَبْدٍ شَرّاً حَبَّبَ إِلَيْهِ الْمَالَ وَبَسَطَ مِنْهُ الْآمَالَ
enWisdom: When Allah wants something bad for a servant, He makes wealth beloved to him and extends his [false] hopes
Abundance of wealth causes destruction, makes one rebellious and perishes

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ مَغْبُوطٍ بِنِعْمَتِهِ وَهُوَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ مِنَ الْهَالِكِينَ
enWisdom: How many a person is envied for the blessing he has been given [in this world] while he is among those who will be destroyed in the Hereafter

Wisdom: لَنْ يَنْجُوَ مِنَ الْمَوْتِ غَنِيٌّ لِكَثْرَةِ مَالِهِ
enWisdom: The affluent person will never be saved from death because of his abundant wealth

Wisdom: لَيْسَ الْخَيْرُ أَنْ يَكْثُرَ مَالُكَ وَوَلَدُكَ إِنَّمَا الْخَيْرُ أَنْ يَكْثُرَ عِلْمُكَ وَيَعْظُمَ حِلْمُكَ
enWisdom: Goodness is not in having more wealth and children, rather goodness is only in possessing more knowledge and greater forbearance

Wisdom: لَا يُكْرِمُ الْمَرْءُ نَفْسَهُ حَتَّى يُهِينَ مَالَهُ
enWisdom: A person does not ennoble himself until he belittles his wealth

Wisdom: لَا يَجْمَعُ الْمَالَ إِلَّا الْحِرْصُ وَالْحَرِيصُ شَقِيٌّ مَذْمُومٌ
enWisdom: Nothing makes one amass wealth except greed, and the greedy is wretched and dispraised

Wisdom: لَا يُبْقِى الْمَالَ إِلَّا الْبُخْلُ وَالْبَخِيلُ مُعَاقَبٌ مَلُومٌ
enWisdom: Nothing holds back wealth except stinginess, and a miser is blameworthy and liable for punishment

Wisdom: لَا غِنَى بِأَحَدٍ مِنَ الِارْتِيَادِ وَقَدْرِ بَلَاغِهِ مِنَ الزَّادِ
enWisdom: No one can dispense with the need to seek his sustenance and that which he requires of provisions
